course_title: Spec Stud:17th/18th Cent Art: Italian Baroque Architecture
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 25Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course will survey architecture and city planning in 17th-century Italy with focus on papal Rome, Bourbon Naples, the Republic of Venice, and the Savoy monarchy in Piedmont. We will consider the careers of architects such as Borromini, Bernini, Pietro da Cortona, Juvarra, and Piranesi. Developments in urban planning: the opening of new streets, the formation of piazze; transformations in church, palace, gallery, villa, and garden designs will be considered in the context of the religious, political, economic, and intellectual developments of the century. Issues of propaganda and control, festival and pageantry, city vs. country will be considered throughout.
Art History major/minor: Division II
Architectural Studies minor: elective
course_description: Topics could include problems in the study of Rubens; poetics and painting; the Carraci reform of art and its consequences; and problems in the study of Rembrandt. May be repeated for credit when topic changes, up to a maximum of twelve hours.
sections: Class Nbr: 3132, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: McPhee/Lin, Status: Open
